title: Thunderbird Events - Organizer has default domain of @internal
content:
When I create a new event by right-clicking on a day on the monthly calendar and then "Invite Attendees" I see in the new pop-up dialog that the organizer of the event has the illegal domain address of "@internal". The attendees receive their invitations but the .ics contains the line

ORGANIZER;PARTSTAT=NEEDS-ACTION;CUTYPE=INDIVIDUAL;SENT-BY="mailto: 

<redacted>":mailto:<redacted>@internal

Since <redacted>@internal is an illegal email address the attendee cannot respond to the invitation either in the affirmative or negative.

How can I change the default domain of the organizer to the email address of the user creating the event? I have searched through all the settings I can find no mention of @internal there or in the documentation on the web.

I have been testing on my Win 8.1 system and Thunderbird 115.16.2 (32-bit), which is the most advanced available. The people I work with experience the same behavior with Thunderbird 128.3.0 on Win 10 and Win 11.

Nothing seems to make it readable, I have to open my browser to view the emails, but it's never all the new emails, just some of them. Anybody had the same issue and fix?

title: Max RcptTo Daily limit

Since 2 days I cannot send email due to a sending error "Max RcptTo Daily limit", but if I send from webmail or Mail by Apple emails are sended and reach the recipients. So that it seems not to be a problem by register.it server, but internal to Thunderbird. In fact, if I change the smtp server with another one with same settings but only different name, everything works.

What can I try to verify and do? I searched any of settings, but not clear what the problem is. Thank you for your help Diego

creator: pkab

title: Filter process
content:
It used to be, (years ago) that the message filters worked, apparently, thus: in descending order- filter applied, message removed message from inbox next filter until the inbox was was empty, OR if not empty yet (because no previous filter matched), a final filter of "match anything" would be applied to the remaining messages in the inbox, and those messages would be moved to the designated folder.

Now, it seems that while the filters are being applied, the message is not moved immediately, but rather is copied to where it is intended, but left in the inbox, marked read, apparently. So, when the final "match anything" filter is encountered, ALL of those previously processed, marked read messages are actually moved (copy/delete, I suppose) to the final designated folder.

So, if this is not a bug, how can I achieve the original behavior?

Some additional, should be irrelevant info: I have one main account which mostly gets things addressed to my @spamcop.net address. Things I'm interested in go to one of maybe 50 folders under that account. Anything else ( that is, left over from the previous filtering ) is supposed to go to the inbox folder of my Spamcop account for possible spam reporting, Marked "unread". As it is, every incoming message goes into that account, marked read. Useless.

A final note is that messages ~moved~ to the main inbox are ignored in normal use, but if I select filters and manually apply them, they work as expected.

Thanks for any help with this. Doug McCrary, long-time user on Ubuntu

P.S. I'm not interested in using IMAP, I have everything else working as I like with POP3.
creator: dougmccrary

Settings are: server name: smtp.office365.com

title: Urgent - Lost messages in Inbox - how can I get them back from a backup?
content:
I have latest version (64 bit) of Thunderbird (automatic updates) on a Windows 10 machine.

A little while ago, I found that many of my messages in my Inbox from earlier this month were showing Gobbledygook. Also the number of messages were only about a quarter of what should be in the Inbox. So I clicked on Properties of the Inbox - the number of messages that were shown in the Repair Window was about right so I clicked on "Repair folder". The repair process seems to have deleted all of the other messages and left my Inbox with just a quarter of what should be there. None of the missing messages are in the Deleted box or the Archives.

So does anyone have a way of getting these deleted messages back?

If not, I do a regular back-up of my Thunderbird profile. How can I go about getting just my Inbox back from the backup. I have years of Archives in my set-up (20GB+). And I am afraid that given what has happened today, I might lose those as well if I restore my whole profile. Ideally, I would like to restore just my back-up Inbox to a second Inbox (Inbox-1) and then just migrate across the missing messages. What files should I copy across from my backup?

The reason I have put urgent in the subject line is that I am in hte middle of some complex issues that require the exchange of a lot of emails and I need to look back at emails that are now missing.
creator: moojanmomen

title: Slow performance
content:
Following a system crash, I downloaded Thunderbird on October 19 or 20. I have used TB for a number of years to deal with my Gmail account and looked forward to continuing to use it. However, the version downloaded has proved to be unusable. It appears to be fixated on uploading a large number of messages from Gmail, four times the number Gmail indicates are in my account. The result is that the program is not responding most of the time. I have uninstalled it and downloaded again, to no effect. It is now uninstalled.

Keep the donation, it has been worth it in the past.

And do let me know when a clean version is available. I really liked it.

creator: sbanfield

title: sudden lost contacts and calendars from Outlook account
content:
I had Tbird running very well on my new MacBook a two months, I have it set to work perfectly with my outlook.com email account for emails, contacts and calendar. I have Tbsync and Provider for exchange add ons. In fact the whole set up was much easier on the Mac than on my old Win10 laptop. I also have BT, Gmail and iCloud email folders set up as well. As state the whole system was working perfectly, calendar events etc all synced and updated my Outlook.com account and also my iPhone. I was extremely pleased with how it was working.

Problem. I switch off my Mac last night as usual. Started up this morning and opened Tbird. Latest emails were duly received from all accounts including my Outlook.com.

However when I went to add a new event I noticed there were no calendars, none! Yesterday there were F1, holidays, personal. I then noticed that my address book was also gone, no contacts, nothing. Just a blank calendar and the empty Tbird default address book. No menu options for getting Outlook contacts or calendar re-set up exist. I feel rather annoyed, is putting it mildly!

Fortunately the data is still there in my Outlook.com account. So not 100% angry.

Despite the fact that I am downloading emails from Outlook.com, plus sending replies and new ones, something has gone missing. I must therefore assume that TBsync 4.11 or Provider for Exchange ActiveSync 4.12 has decided to go on vacation.

Tbird is version 128.3.3esr (64-bit) No updates have been requested or installed for months. It just simply was working well and then decided not too!

Any ideas for a fix? Or do I remove everything and start a fresh setup
creator: radiusdisc

title: Thunderbird 128 not getting messages
content:
T'bird (128.3.2esr, MacOs 12.7.6) suddenly stopped picking up messages from one of my two email accounts about a week ago. I can see the mail using webmail, and I have checked that the username and password are correct. Following instructions on this site, I have removed the password from memory, quit and restarted, after which "You will be prompted to enter a new password for the account" (which does not happen!)

When I select Get New Messages, nothing happens. No prompt for a password, nothing.

I am not using any antivirus programs.

T'bird has from time to time in the past asked me to confirm security exceptions for this site, but not recently. Has something changed in this area?

title: Spam messed up...............
content:
Just updated. Big mistake!!! The "spam filter was great", now it's not. Your not allowed to complain because all these people work for free to make it great. But, they just have to change a good thing up so they have something to do. I use to get the rare spam mixed into my mail, and no spam in the junk mailbox. Now since a recent change in the last week, I have spam every where. Duplicate spam too! In my in box, in junk mail. It's like Yahoo mail now. Two pieces of mail, and a spam mailbox with 50 pieces of junk mail. This is just like the weird change a couple of years ago when after you deleted your mail, it just showed up again. That's when I was told how ungrateful I was for complaining. All the poor Mozilla patriots, slaving away to make the World a better place. Changing stuff just to be changing stuff! I guess they want to work at Microsoft. Here comes Windows the Dozen. Greatest yet! Why did I push that upgrade Thunderbird button.

P.S. Watch me get called dumb because Mozilla doesn't have anything to do with Thunderbird. Oh, wait, Mozilla took Thunderbird back. I'm safe!
creator: c.capers1

title: About Multiple Accounts and Mailboxes
content:
Thumderbird is great in being able to support multiple email addresses and accounts.

Wanted to ask, is it possible to migrate other email account mailboxes into the multiple account in Thunderbird?

Example: I have an existing email account in Eudora for “Mark” and several mailboxes. Also have a an account “Management Online” and mailboxes there. (Both in Eudora)

When setting up the individual multiple accounts in Thunderbird, can I import or migrate the mailboxes into each of the Thunderbird “Mark” and “Management Online” accounts in Thunderbird?

How to do so?

Thank you.

title: TBird not checking my mail folders after update?
content:
Hi. My tbird app is not checking all of my mail account for new mail. I have four accounts, same mail server, DNS is all correct, etc. I noticed that I was not getting mail, so I sent some mail from gmail to my business accounts (accesses by TBird only) and response was "no mail". Looked later, still no mail. Then, "new mail" but only on one account. Arrival time was about 8 minutes after sending but I was clicking "check messages" frequently for the first two or three minutes. My setting is every ten minutes - check for new mail.

TBird is completely skipping two other accounts. And this is quite odd because tbird has always functioned perfectly for me, for years, maybe decades. This is a new, seemingly random development that seems to coincide with the last update 128.3.3esr (32-bit).

I also find it odd that I have server locations pop3.*****.com and smtp.*****.com, instead of either pop3 or smtp on all mail accounts.

Can I roll back an update or two and see if that helps? I do not want to reinstall and lose mail, and heck, it could even be my host, generally perfect in execution but who knows? Would CDN service break email? I initiated CDN two days ago. Maybe, right?
creator: jwdavis1957
